name: slurp
content:
Add to word list

[ I or T ] informal to drink a liquid noisily as a result of sucking air into the mouth at the same time as the liquid: Try not to slurp. I wish you wouldn't slurp your soup like that. He slurped down his coffee.

[ I ] UK informal When a thick liquid slurps, it makes loud noises: The lava slurped and bubbled down the mountainside.

an amount of liquid that you drink noisily: She paused to take a slurp of lemonade. "I don't have a clue," said Bill between slurps.
the sound someone makes when they drink noisily: They wolfed down their food in silence, punctuated only by slurps, grunts, and scraping knives. All of the tasters have their own distinct slurps.
More examplesFewer examplesHe took a slurp from his mug as he carried it back to his chair.He drinks a slurp of coffee and stares past me. For maximum benefit, take small slurps of water throughout the day.
